tool.name: PermAnalysisSIMLR
tool.command:
tar -zxvf $tar_Clustering -C /scratch && Rscript /home/main.R annotated_matrix $Range1 $Range2 $Format $Separator $Sp 0.05 0.01 0.05 2>>$log &&
mkdir -p ${html_file.files_path} && tar -zcvf zipOutput.tar.gz -C /scratch/ . 2>>$log && cp -R /scratch/* ${html_file.extra_files_path} && tree $html_file.extra_files_path -H . -T "permutationAnalysis" -o $html_file

param.name: tar_Clustering
param.help: tar input from PermutationClustering that used SIMLR or tSne clustering method

param.name: Range1
param.help: First number of cluster that has to be analyzed

param.name: Range2
param.help: Last number of cluster that has to be analyzed

param.name: Sp
param.help: minimun number of percentage of cells that has to be in common between two permutation to be the same cluster

tool.help:
permutationAnalysis perform the statistic evaluation assigning a cell stability score to each cell.
**IMPORTANT** This function works on SIMLR and tSne clustering algorithm.
